ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually the area they are talking about are the Sol rooms .  They consist of 3 seperate, but linked rooms (ie pulling from one room will pull from the other
ygData.messageBody:
Actually the area they are talking about are the 'Sol rooms'. They consist
of 3 seperate, but linked rooms (ie pulling from one room will pull from the
other 2 if not done correctly). The three rooms are the King (several spawn
points 2 rares: the King and a Monk quest spawn), Priest (3 or 4 spawns 1
rare: The Priest), and the Champ room (again several spawn points and the
Champion rare spawn). On Karana is anyone tried to claim all three rooms
during prime-time they would be laughed out of the zone.

Rokenn

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 9:54 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"


From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>

The postings made it clear its worse than that. If a room has two named
spawns a second group can freely waltz in and demand to be allowed to camp
one of the named spawns. If its a room with two different items that
different classes in your group wants, suddenly part of your group has
nothing to gain from camping the room and will likely leave in disgust after
this happens two or three times.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 10:54 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"


From: "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...>

Must be nice to camp multiple spawns :) On Karana each room is seperate
camp, has been for months.

Rokenn

-----Original Message-----
From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 9:46 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"


From: jhenders@...

On Thu, Mar 16/00, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...> wrote:
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
>
> Right, but all it takes is one of these groups who will not agree to a
> compromise to force an intervention by "Big Brother". They make it
> perfectly clear that No One will like the decision that "Big Brother" is
> going to make so you better sort it out yourselves. This is just an
> invitation to get someone to officially irritate someone for those who
> desire to irritate. They know they won't like the compromise already, so
> they are perfectly willing to use the threat of forcing others to accept
> "Big Brother's" unacceptable ruling to bend reasonable people to their
will.
>

Check out this guild's use of the Play Nice policy to break the player
made agreement that's been in effect in Sol B on our server. They did it
the first day of the new policy.

http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum38/HTML/000173.html
